2000.info: The start game event is triggered at the very beginning of the game (after the game finishes loading, don't wait for intro movie to finish). This is used to compute things like time spent in game.

args.info: version identifier for the current build of the game
args.name: version

2020.info: The start round event is triggered at the start of a round when a new round of ingredients is being chosen for a customer. This event provides information about the game characteristics of the round (i.e. resources, objectives, setup). It is used in calculating things like time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has visited (exposures).

args.info: number of the round that is about to begin
args.name: serving_round

args.info:
"the requested recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int, ""bake_time"": int}"
args.name: target_recipe

args.info: name of recipe to make
args.name: recipe_name

2025.info: The start round event is triggered at the start of a round when a new round of ingredients is being chosen to create a new recipe. This event provides information about the game characteristics of the round (i.e. resources, objectives, setup). It is used in calculating things like time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has visited (exposures).

args.info: number of the round that is about to begin
args.name: making_round

args.info: number of already created recipes
args.name: known_recipes

2027.info: The start decorating event is triggered when the player is prompted to decorate a cookie. This event provides information about a separate area of gameplay from the rest of the serving portion of the game. It is used in calculating things like time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy).

args.info: number of the round the decorating mode takes place after
args.name: serving_round

2030.info: The beat round event is triggered when the player finishes a round and the customer is satisfied with the cookie. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has completed (completion).

args.info: number of the round that has just completed
args.name: serving_round

args.info: the duration of the round in milliseconds. Time between start round and beat round.
args.name: duration

args.info: the number of times an incorrect cookie was submitted during the round
args.name: misses

args.info: the number of times the reset button was pressed during the round
args.name: resets

args.info: true if the player is sent back to the main screen after completing this round
args.name: return_home

2035.info: The beat round event is triggered when the player finishes a round and creates a new recipe. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has completed (completion).

args.info: number of the round that has just completed
args.name: making_round

args.info: name of recipe that was created
args.name: recipe_name

args.info: number of created recipes (including this one)
args.name: known_recipes

args.info: true if the player is sent back to the main screen after completing this round
args.name: return_home

args.info: the number of times the reset button was pressed during the round
args.name: resets

2037.info: The end decorating event is triggered when the player finishes decorating a cookie. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy).

args.info: number of the round that has just completed
args.name: serving_round

args.info: list of decorations used on the cookie (I don't think there is any value in knowing the placements of the decorations)
args.name: decorations

args.info: the duration of the decorating section in milliseconds. Time between start decorating and end decorating.
args.name: duration

2040.info: The start serving mode event is triggered when the player begins a set of serving rounds. It is used in calculating things like time spent in a level and the number of levels the player has visited (exposures).

2050.info: The end serving mode event is triggered when the player finishes a set of serving rounds. It is used in calculating things like time spent in a level and the number of levels the player has visited (exposures).

args.info: the duration of the level in milliseconds. Time between start level and beat level.
args.name: duration

args.info: the number of times an incorrect cookie was submitted during the level
args.name: misses

args.info: the number of times the undo button was pressed during the level
args.name: undos

2080.info: The movie started event triggers when an intro or outro movie starts to play. It identifies the movie being played. This is used to determine how long players spend watching the movies (more relevant after the first play through when the skip option is available). The movie_id should be a string composed of the voiceover audio id, and the number and type of each animal with colon separators. Example: 'goodjob:2_chicken:1_cow'

args.info: the identifier for the movie that was playing
args.name: movie_id

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

2081.info: The movie skipped event triggers when the player presses the skip button during an intro or outro movie. It identifies the movie being played. This is used to determine how long players spend watching the movies (more relevant after the first play through when the skip option is available). The movie_id should be a string composed of the voiceover audio id, and the number and type of each animal with colon separators. Example: 'goodjob:2_chicken:1_cow'

args.info: the identifier for the movie that was playing
args.name: movie_id

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the time the media has been playing milliseconds when the button is pressed
args.name: time_played

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

2083.info: The movie ended event triggers when an intro or outro movie ends. It identifies the movie being played. This is used to determine how long players spend watching the movies (more relevant after the first play through when the skip option is available). The movie_id should be a string composed of the voiceover audio id, and the number and type of each animal with colon separators. Example: 'goodjob:2_chicken:1_cow'

args.info: the identifier for the movie that was playing
args.name: movie_id

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

3010.info: The system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game delivers instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. This event differs from events 3020 and 3021 as it captures instructions that are not given in response to player action. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions. We can answer questions like, 'did players who received instruction X do better than those who did not?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3020.info: The system-initiated feedback (Incorrect) event occurs when the game starts delivering feedback to the player in response to an incorrect round attempt (pressing the go button with the incorrect answer). It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, 'did players who received feedback X do better than those who did not?'

args.info:
the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: name of the current round (i.e., stretchy) when the event takes place or 'NA' if no round
args.name: round_name

3021.info: The system-initiated feedback (Correct) event occurs when the game starts delivering feedback to the player in response to a correct round attempt (pressing the go button with the correct answer). It contains information that describes the content of the instruction, and will likely occur in conjunction with a beat round event. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, 'did players who received feedback X do better than those who did not?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3110.info: The end of system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game finishes delivering instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction including duration. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions and the amount of time they consume. We can answer questions like, 'how much time elapsed while the game was presenting instruction?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3120.info: The end of system-initiated feedback (Incorrect) event occurs when the game finishes delivering feedback to the player in response to an incorrect round attempt (pressing the go button with the incorrect answer). It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, 'how much time elapsed while the game was presenting feedback?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3121.info: The end of system-initiated feedback (Correct) event occurs when the game finishes delivering feedback to the player in response to a correct round attempt (pressing the go button with the correct answer). It contains information that describes the duration and content of the instruction, and will likely occur in conjunction with a beat round event. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, 'how much time elapsed while the game was presenting feedback?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

4010.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to start the game from the starting screen.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4011.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to choose the play mode from the initial choices screen.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4012.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to choose the create mode from the initial choices screen.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4020.info: This event occurs when the player adds an ingredient to the mixture when serving customers. It contains information about the ingredient selected, the correctness of the action, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: does adding this ingredient give us more than the recipe calls for?
args.name: over_recipe

args.info: type of ingredient being added
args.name: ingredient

args.info: 'drag' or 'click' method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info:
"the currently assembled recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

args.info:
"the requested recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: target_recipe

4021.info: This event occurs when the player adds an ingredient to the mixture when making new recipes. It contains information about the ingredient selected, the correctness of the action, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: type of ingredient being added
args.name: ingredient

args.info: 'drag' or 'click' method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info:
"the currently assembled recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

4023.info: The adjust time event occurs when the player changes the temperatue of the oven when preparing a cookie for a customer. It contains information about the time selected, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: "increase" or "decrease" - which way the time is being adjusted
args.name: direction

args.info: the new time of the oven
args.name: bake_time

args.info: the time in the requested recipe
args.name: target_time

4024.info: The adjust time event occurs when the player changes the temperatue of the oven when creating a new recipe. It contains information about the time selected, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: "increase" or "decrease" - which way the time is being adjusted
args.name: direction

args.info: the new time of the oven
args.name: bake_time

4030.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to pick up or begins dragging an ingredient when preparing a recipe for a customer. It contains information about the ingredient being moved, the position of the click, and the state of the game. This event is used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: 'drag' or 'click' method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info:
"the currently assembled recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

args.info:
"the requested recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: target_recipe

4031.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to pick up or begins dragging an object in create mode when creating a new recipe. It contains information about the object being moved, the position of the click, and the state of the game area. This event is used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: 'drag' or 'click' method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info:
"the currently assembled recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

4035.info: This event occurs when the player drags an ingredient to someplace other than an acceptable destination for the ingredient. It contains information about the ingredient being moved and the destination. The event should occur when the drag is released and the object is placed. These events are used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: type of ingredient being added
args.name: ingredient

args.info: 'drag' or 'click' method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

4050.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the next button to advance between screens. It contains information about the transitioning screens and the location of the click.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: name of the screen being transitioned to
args.name: new_screen

args.info: name of the previous screen
args.name: prev_screen

4070.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on something that isn't covered elsewhere. It can be useful in determining if there are attractive distractions (things the player think should do something, but don't) in the game, or diagnosing players who are having mechanical difficulties (near misses).

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4080.info: This event occurs when the player hovers the mouse over an interactive object. It contains information about the object under the mouse, and the duration of the hover. This event can be used to diagnose things like planning (are they hovering the mouse over tiles for long periods before they use those tiles), and determine which objects the player thinks are important.

args.info: how long the mouse cursor dwells over the object when the player dwells for longer than 1sec
args.name: dwell_time

args.info: the object the mouse was hovering over
args.name: object

4095.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on the trash can icon to reset the ingredients in the bowl when preparing a cookie for a customer. It contains information about the ingredients that were cleared.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"the currently assembled recipe before the reset
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

4096.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on the trash can icon to reset the ingredients in the bowl when creating a new recipe. It contains information about the ingredients that were cleared.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"the currently assembled recipe before the reset
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

4100.info: The clicked done event occurs when the player clicks the arrow to continue after selecting the oven time when preparing a cookie for a customer. It contains information about the cookie recipe made, and the correctness of the recipe. This event is used to calculate accuracy and to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: was this the requested recipe?
args.name: correct

args.info:
"the submitted recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int, ""bake_time"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

args.info:
"the requested recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int, ""bake_time"": int}"
args.name: target_recipe

4101.info: The clicked done event occurs when the player clicks the arrow to continue after selecting the oven time when creating a new recipe. It contains information about the cookie recipe made. This event is used to calculate accuracy and to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: was the submitted recipe a new unique recipe?
args.name: new_recipe

args.info:
"the submitted recipe
{""eggs"": int, ""butter"": int, ""salt"": int, ""sugar"": int, ""bake_time"": int}"
args.name: current_recipe

args.info: number of already created recipes
args.name: known_recipes

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3110.info: The end of system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game finishes delivering instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction including duration. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions and the amount of time they consume. We can answer questions like, 'how much time elapsed while the game was presenting instruction?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3120.info: The end of system-initiated feedback (Incorrect) event occurs when the game finishes delivering feedback to the player in response to an incorrect round attempt (pressing the go button with the incorrect answer). It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, 'how much time elapsed while the game was presenting feedback?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3121.info: The end of system-initiated feedback (Correct) event occurs when the game finishes delivering feedback to the player in response to a correct round attempt (pressing the go button with the correct answer). It contains information that describes the duration and content of the instruction, and will likely occur in conjunction with a beat round event. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the feedback. We can answer questions like, 'how much time elapsed while the game was presenting feedback?'

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

4035.info: This event occurs when the player drags an ingredient to someplace other than an acceptable destination for the ingredient. It contains information about the ingredient being moved and the destination. The event should occur when the drag is released and the object is placed. These events are used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4050.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the next button to advance between screens. It contains information about the transitioning screens and the location of the click.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: name of the screen being transitioned to
args.name: new_screen

args.info: name of the previous screen
args.name: prev_screen

4070.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on something that isn't covered elsewhere. It can be useful in determining if there are attractive distractions (things the player think should do something, but don't) in the game, or diagnosing players who are having mechanical difficulties (near misses).

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{'x': integer, 'y': integer, 'stage_width': integer, 'stage_height': integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4080.info: This event occurs when the player hovers the mouse over an interactive object. It contains information about the object under the mouse, and the duration of the hover. This event can be used to diagnose things like planning (are they hovering the mouse over tiles for long periods before they use those tiles), and determine which objects the player thinks are important.

args.info: how long the mouse cursor dwells over the object when the player dwells for longer than 1sec
args.name: dwell_time

args.info: the object the mouse was hovering over
args.name: object
